treatment.description: Leaves: petiole short stipitate-glandular or sparsely long stipitate-glandular; blade pen-tagonal, deeply lobed. Inflores-cences short stipitate-glandular. Flowers: hypanthium hemi-spheric, 1–3.5 × 1–3.5 mm (1 times long as wide), short stipitate-glandular; sepals 0.5–1.5 mm, apex broadly rounded; petals 0.4–1.4 mm wide; styles 1.2–3.9 mm.
treatment.habitat: Mixed evergreen forest on limestone or serpentine-derived soils
treatment.discussion: Variety macropetala is known from the Klamath and Siskiyou mountains.
